'''Elvira Kurt''' (born December 9, 1961) is a [[Canadian]] [[comedian]], and the host of the game show ''[[Spin Off (Canadian game show)|Spin Off]]''.<ref name="Spin Off">{{cite web |url=http://www.chch.com/shows/spinoff/ |accessdate=2013-09-01 |title=Spin Off |publisher=CHCH |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130820080525/http://www.chch.com/shows/spinoff/ |archivedate=2013-08-20 |df= }}</ref> She hosted the entertainment satire/[[talk show]] ''[[PopCultured]] with Elvira Kurt'', which began on [[The Comedy Network]] in Canada in 2005. That show's style was similar to ''[[The Daily Show|The Daily Show with Jon Stewart]]''. It was cancelled due to poor ratings in early 2006. She is of Jewish [[Hungary|Hungarian]] descent.
[[Coming out|Openly]] [[lesbian]],<ref name="afterellen">{{citation |last=Polly |first=John |date=2007-03-07 |url=http://www.afterellen.com/people/2007/3/elvirakurt |title=Interview With Elvira Kurt |periodical=[[AfterEllen.com]] |accessdate=2007-10-30 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080127123359/http://www.afterellen.com/people/2007/3/elvirakurt |archivedate=2008-01-27 |df= }}</ref> she coined the term "fellagirly" to describe herself and other lesbians whose style is a blend of [[butch and femme]], as opposed to strictly one or the other. Her comedic style relies heavily on complaints about [[celebrity culture]], her own appearance, and the effects of aging.
She performed at the inaugural ''[[We're Funny That Way!]]'' comedy festival in 1997, and appeared in the festival's documentary film in 1998.<ref name=laughing>{{cite web|title=Laughing out loud: Gay and lesbian comics go the extra comedic mile on TV special|work=[[The Gazette (Montreal)|The Gazette]]|date=February 9, 1999}}</ref>
In 2007, Kurt hosted the second season of the gay wedding series ''[[My Fabulous Gay Wedding|First Comes Love]]'' (which originated in Canada under the title ''[[My Fabulous Gay Wedding]]''). She is a judge on ''[[The Second City's Next Comedy Legend]]'', a frequent guest on the [[CBC Radio]] show ''[[The Debaters]]'', and a weekly guest on ''[[Q (radio show)|Q]]'' where she does a "Cultural Hall of Shame" segment each week, typically on the last half-hour on the Friday morning broadcast.
Kurt is the host of ''Spin Off'', a prime time [[quiz show]] on [[Hamilton, Ontario|Hamilton]] based television station [[CHCH-DT]]. [[Mark Burnett]] is executive producer and creator of ''Spin Off'',<ref>{{cite web |url=http://playbackonline.ca/2013/04/23/chch-buys-mark-burnett-game-show/ |work=PlayBack |author=Etan Vlessing |date=2013-04-23 |accessdate=2013-09-01 |title=CHCH buys Mark Burnett game show}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.thestar.com/entertainment/television/2013/04/24/mark_burnett_behind_spin_off_new_game_show_to_air_on_chch.html |work=Toronto Star |agency=Canadian Press |title=Mark Burnett behind Spin Off, new game show to air on CHCH |date=2013-04-24 |accessdate=2013-09-01}}</ref> which premiered on September 11, 2013.<ref name="Spin Off"/>
